intro: Euxylophora paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense xylophore, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
